P106443.project_name: PH-Support for Basic Ed. Sector Reform

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Support to Basic Education Reforms Project is to support the implementation of the Philippine government's Basic Education Sector Reform Agenda (BESRA) which in turn aims to contribute to the achievement of the Philippines' basic education goal of improving quality and equity in learning outcomes. The project was originally approved on June 2, 2008 for a total grant amount of US$32 million from the Australian Agency for International Aid (AusAID). In view of implementation delays encountered by the project, the changes include: (a) reallocation of grant proceeds across expenditure categories; (b) extension of closing date from December 31, 2012 to May 31, 2013; and (c) adjustment of the results framework targets to reflect the extension period and align these with the current targets in the Philippine Development Plan 2011-2016. This will be the second extension of the project. The first extension was for 18 months, from July 1, 2011 to December 31, 2012.
